title: Barrie Masters, singer with Eddie and the Hot Rods, whose brand of high-energy pub rock paved the way for the punk revolution – obituary
text:
Barrie Masters, who has died suddenly aged 63, was the charismatic, high-energy singer with Eddie and the Hot Rods, leading lights of the mid-1970s pub rock scene that fed into the punk revolution; over the decades he remained the band’s only ever-present member as the line-up shifted in splits and reunions.

Founded in Canvey Island, Essex, in 1975, the band had four Top 40 singles and are probably best remembered for their 1977 hit Do Anything You Wanna Do. Stripped to the waist, sweat flying in all directions, Masters resembled a teenage Mick Jagger; behind him, the band had all the musical chops of punk with none of the “no future” nihilism.

Richard Holgarth, one of the Rods’ many guitarists...
description: Barrie Masters, who has died suddenly aged 63, was the charismatic, high-energy singer with Eddie and the Hot Rods, leading lights of the mid-1970s pub rock scene that fed into the punk revolution;
